prompt.template:
You are an expert in emotion analysis. Given a sentence or paragraph, your task is to estimate the emotional intensity for each of 27 emotions defined in the GoEmotions dataset. Each emotion should be scored between 0.0 (not present) and 1.0 (very strongly present). Multiple emotions may be present at once.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY a valid JSON object. Do not include any other text, explanations, or markdown formatting. The JSON must use double quotes for keys and values.

Here are the 27 emotion labels:
{emotion_labels}

Input: "{input_text}"

Respond with ONLY the JSON object:

variables.emotion_labels: admiration, amusement, anger, annoyance, approval, caring, confusion, curiosity, desire, disappointment, disapproval, disgust, embarrassment, excitement, fear, gratitude, grief, joy, love, nervousness, optimism, pride, realization, relief, remorse, sadness, surprise

prompt.instructions: Return only valid JSON with emotion scores between 0.0 and 1.0. Use double quotes for all keys and values. Do not include any other text or formatting.

description:
Emotion Classification Experiment using Mistral 7B Instruct

A high-performing, industry-standard 7.3B parameter model, with optimizations for speed and context length. Mistral 7B Instruct has multiple version variants, and this is intended to be the latest version.

This experiment evaluates the performance of Mistral 7B Instruct on the GoEmotions dataset for multi-label emotion classification. The model is tested using zero-shot prompting with a comprehensive prompt that includes all 27 emotion labels.

Model: mistralai/mistral-7b-instruct:free
Temperature: 0.1
Dataset: GoEmotions validation set
Sampling: Stratified sampling with exactly 1 sample per emotion
Reproducibility: Fixed random seed (42) ensures same dataset on each run
Metrics: Macro/Micro F1, Precision, Recall, Top-2/3 Accuracy/Precision/Recall/F1, Per-emotion performance
Output: CSV with detailed results, MLflow tracking for all metrics

metadata.notes: Mistral 7B Instruct is expected to perform well on emotion classification tasks as it's a larger, more capable model compared to Ministral 3B. The 7.3B parameters and industry-standard optimizations should provide better instruction following and JSON output compliance.
